require- loading, compiling and caching of every file used..basically loads and external module.
createServer - The http.createServer() method turns your computer into an HTTP server.
The http.createServer() method creates an HTTP Server object.
The HTTP Server object can listen to ports on your computer and execute a function, a requestListener, each time a request is made.

url.parse - it parses the url given.
(req.url).query - it shows the url after ?
so both combined it will parse the url after ?

reverse-string is the library downloaded which helps in reversing the string

req-request
res-response
res.writeHead - it will write the header i.e  First, it sends HTTP status code 200, which means "OK, everything is good".
and then it sets some response headers.In this case, it's saying that we're sending back the plaintext content-type.
res.end-at the end of url and header formation- it will print the hash
listen- listening at 8082

blueimp-md5 is the most popular amongst all hashes and compatible with node js

37a6259cc0c1dae299a7866489dff0bd
reversed form - db0ffd9846687a992ead1c0cc9526a73

reverse-7d6060495a2ab0f2511536971e19041d
original- d14091e1796351152f0ba2a5940606d7
